slogan: We seek to foster the academic, social and physical growth of students to reach the maximum potential of each one.

summary.text: We are constantly focused on perfecting our methods to improve the health and education of children. We work for them.

view_home.first_paragraph: At Eureka, we are committed to providing a nurturing environment where students with special needs can thrive academically, socially, and physically. Our goal is to empower each student to reach their full potential through a comprehensive and individualized approach to education.
view_home.second_paragraph: We offer a unique curriculum that blends core academic subjects with specialized programs in areas like farming, gardening, and life skills. With a wide range of services and therapies, we ensure that every child receives the support they need to succeed both in and outside of the classroom. At Eureka Educational Academy, we celebrate each student's individuality and are proud to provide an inclusive and supportive community where they can grow, learn, and thrive.
view_home.first_block:
Eureka Educational Academy provides a
 variety of therapy services integrated
 within the school day:
view_home.second_block: Eureka Educational Academy accepts the following scholarships:
view_home.data_response: Your request was successfully submitted, someone will be in touch with you within the next 24 hours.
view_home.error_message: Please try again and if the problem persists write directly to our email.

view_therapy.first_paragraph:
Eureka Educational Academy provides a full complement of therapy services that are
 integrated within the educational setting during school hours. The integration provides
 students with appropriate therapies in a real world environment, while fully supporting
 their educational goals and experiences.
view_therapy.second_paragraph:
In addition, the school provides opportunities for one-to-one therapy sessions that maximize the effectiveness of each therapy service, when found appropriate. This
provides families with wrap-around services, eliminating the need to spend additional hours seeking therapies in other locations. Our hope is that these services enable families to truly improve the quality of their family life.

view_philosophy.title: Philosophy
view_philosophy.first_paragraph: At Eureka Educational Academy, we believe in providing a holistic educational experience that nurtures the intellectual, emotional, and social development of each student. Our philosophy is grounded in the idea that education should be both academically rigorous and practically meaningful.
view_philosophy.second_paragraph: We offer a strong foundation in all core academic subjects—math, language arts, science, and social studies—while also integrating innovative programs like farming and gardening. These programs enrich our students' learning, allowing them to apply academic concepts in real-life contexts. Through hands-on experiences, students gain essential life skills, including responsibility, problem-solving, and critical thinking, all of which are integral to their overall growth and success.
view_philosophy.third_paragraph: We recognize that every student learns differently, which is why our curriculum is tailored to meet the unique needs of each individual. Our dedicated team works to provide a nurturing and inclusive environment that encourages curiosity, creativity, and academic achievement. At Eureka, we believe in teaching the whole child, preparing them not only for academic success but also for a fulfilling, independent future.

view_about.title: About Eureka Educational Academy
view_about.first_paragraph: Welcome to Eureka Educational Academy, a private school dedicated to providing a personalized and supportive learning experience for students from PreK through 12th grade. With over 75 years of experience in the field of special education, we are committed to fostering a nurturing environment where every child can thrive academically, socially, and emotionally. At Eureka, we understand that every student learns differently. Our curriculum is designed to cater to the unique needs of each child, incorporating core subjects such as mathematics, science, language arts, and social studies, while also offering specialized programs in farming, gardening, and life skills. These programs provide hands-on learning opportunities that connect classroom lessons to real-world experiences.
view_about.second_paragraph: Our dedicated team of educators, therapists, and support staff work collaboratively to create individualized learning plans that empower students to achieve their full potential. Whether through one-on-one instruction, small group activities, or specialized therapies, we ensure that each child receives the personalized support they need to succeed. At Eureka Educational Academy, we are not just a school; we are a community where students are encouraged to explore their strengths, build confidence, and embark on a path toward lifelong success.
view_about.missconduct_first_paragraph: All employees and agents of a public school district, charter school or private school have an obligation and legal responsibility to report misconduct by instructional personnel andschool administrators which affects the health, safety or welfareof a student
view_about.missconduct_second_paragraph: Failure to report misconduct may result in penalties up to termination of employment and revocation of an educator’s certificate.
view_about.missconduct_third_paragraph: If someone tells you about misconduct, be a LEADER:
view_about.missconduct_fourth_paragraph: Listen, Evaluate, Act immediately, Document, Encourage, Report
view_about.missconduct_fifth_paragraph: Report misconduct by school personnel please contact the school administration at EDUCATIONAL ACADEMY
view_about.name: Name
view_about.conduct_first_paragraph: The Eureka Educational Academy, Inc., upholds a set of Standards of Ethical Conduct that prioritize the worth and dignity of every individual, the pursuit of truth, and the development of students. The standards emphasize freedom in learning and teaching, equal opportunities, and professional growth. Key points include ensuring a safe learning environment, avoiding discrimination, maintaining confidentiality, and exhibiting honesty in professional dealings.
view_about.conduct_second_paragraph: Employees are required to undergo training on these ethical standards annually. The document stresses the obligation to report misconduct by instructional personnel and administrators, listing examples such as obscene language, drug use, and physical aggression. Legally sufficient allegations are reported to the Office of Professional Practices Services.
view_about.conduct_third_paragraph: Additionally, all employees have a duty to report cases of child abuse, abandonment, or neglect. Signs of abuse, including physical, sexual, and neglect, are outlined. The document provides liability protections for individuals acting in good faith when reporting instances of child abuse and for employers disclosing information about current or former employees to prospective employers.

view_admission.title: Admissions
view_admission.first_paragraph:
Eureka Educational Academy has a rolling enrollment throughout the academic year.
However, once student enrollment is at capacity, a waiting list will be established in order to provide students an opportunity to join our family when an opening becomes available.
view_admission.second_paragraph: Prospective students and families may schedule a private tour and consultation in order to discuss program and enrollment details.

view_scholarships.description: Eureka Educational Academy accepts the following Step Up for Students scholarships:

view_scholarships.florida_tax_credit_description:
Step Up For Students is currently accepting applications for the 2021-2022 school year. 
 The application and all required documents must be submitted by June 1, 2021.

Students renewing their
Gardiner Scholarship may now apply for the 2021-22 school year through Step
Up For Students. Renewal students will have funding
priority until April 30, 2021.
view_scholarships.gardiner_scholarship_description2: New students will be able to apply in late April 2021. To sign up to be notified when new applications open,
view_scholarships.john_mcKay_scholarship_description:
Any parent of a public school student with a
disability who has an
Individual Education Plan
(IEP) or a 504 accommodation plan may receive a McKay
Scholarship if the student meets the Department of
Education’s requirements.
view_scholarships.text_bottom: We can provide additional information on the scholarships available, as well as how to receive assistance during the application process.
view_scholarships.message: Contact us for more information related to scholarships available and how to receive assistance to apply.

procurement.title: Procurement
procurement.first_paragraph: We are writing to express our interest in procuring food services for our school, Eureka Educational Academy, which is actively pursuing participation in the National School Lunch Program (NSLP).
procurement.second_paragraph: As you may be aware, the NSLP plays a crucial role in providing nutritious meals to schoolchildren across the country. It is our goal to become a participating school in this program to ensure that our students have access to well-balanced and wholesome meals every day. In this endeavor, selecting the right food vendor is of paramount importance.
procurement.third_paragraph: At Eureka Educational Academy, we are dedicated to fostering a nurturing and conducive learning environment for our students. We believe that access to nutritious meals is a fundamental aspect of their overall well-being and academic success. Your reputation and expertise in the food industry make your company an ideal candidate to partner with us in this venture.
procurement.fourth_paragraph: Our school serves a diverse student population of approximately 35 students, and we are looking for a food vendor who can meet the unique needs and requirements of our school community.
procurement.fifth_paragraph: We would like to invite your company to submit a proposal outlining how you can meet these criteria and provide the best food services for our school as we work toward participation in the NSLP. Please include details about your menu options, pricing structure, food sourcing practices, and any additional services or benefits you can offer.
procurement.sixth_paragraph: If you are interested in pursuing this opportunity, kindly submit your proposal to us. Should you have any inquiries or require further clarification, please direct them at info@theeurekaacademy.com or 305-420-6690.
procurement.seventh_paragraph: We appreciate your consideration and eagerly anticipate the possibility of collaborating with you to enhance our students' dining experience and support their educational journey. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

foot_contact.text: For more information on our therapy services, please call or email:
foot_contact.disclaimer: The school will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, disability, or sexual orientation in administration of its educational policies, scholarships, loans, tuition remission, fee waivers, educational programs, athletics, or extracurricular activities.

faq.answer1:
Eureka provides individualized learning plans that are built with several curriculums based on the specific needs of each child. All of the selected curriculums are research based and approved by the Florida Department of Education.
For more specific information you can contact the admissions staff at (305) 420-6690 or via email at info@theeurekaacademy.com.
faq.question2: What type of services are provided?
faq.answer2: The school will provide individualized learning plans based on the specific needs of each student. In addition, we will provide behavior therapy, mental health counseling, speech and language therapy, and occupational therapy.
faq.answer3: The first step is to make an appointment with the school to evaluate your child’s specific educational needs, scholarship opportunities and financial aid. The enrollment process will be explained in detail after the initial meeting.
faq.answer4:
Appointments for tours can be scheduled by calling (305) 420-6690 or emailing info@theeurekaacademy.com.
We are open 5 days a week from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. If you cannot fit these hours special arrangements can be made by calling our office and speaking with the admissions staff.
faq.answer5: Yes, please call (305) 420-6690 for more details.
faq.question6: Does the school accept Florida Choice Scholarships?
faq.answer6: Yes, our admissions staff can also provide additional information to guide you in the process.
faq.question7: Is there any financial aid available?
faq.answer7: Yes, additional financial aid is available during the application process. Please call our admissions staff at (305) 420-6690 for more details.
faq.answer8: We follow the Miami Dade County Public Schools calendar, with a few exceptions.
faq.question9: Does the school offer before and after school care?
faq.answer9: Yes, there are fees associated with these services and financial aid is also available during the application process.
